content.description: Start on the obvious ledge.  Climb up passing 3 bolts to the cold shuts.  Slightly overhanging and sloping at the top.  Crux at finish.  May need brushed at the top (well worth the effort).  Probably hasn't been climbed recently.  Very good climb when brushed.
content.location: Center route of the 3 bolted routes on the right of this block. Route #12 on Bulge Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Top rope route on the far left of the face in the corridor of Bulge Block.
content.location: Route #4 on Bulge Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: This climb was originally done on gear and given the poor pro at the top, had quite the finish.  In the time since its first ascent, it saw very little traffic and became so green it was virtually unclimbable.  During the re-equip, we spent two days cleaning this face and then, because of misinformation at the time, it was decided to put bolts on this route.  At least now with the bolt protection, hopefully the climb will see some traffic and stay reasonably clean.  Start left of the roof and climb up the obvious vertical line.
content.location:
Located just left of the arete (Lucky Charm 5.10a)

 Route #8 on Bulge Block on 2019 guide.

Furthest right of four climbs on left hand side of Bulge Block.

 Route #7 on Bulge Block on 2019 guide.

content.description:
This route climbs just to the left of the arete on the right hand side of the face of Bulge Block that is parallel to the trail (#9 in the new guide).  Like it's neighbor, "Puckered Green," misinformation led us to mistakenly put bolts on this route that had been previously climbed on gear.  We have offered to remove the bolts but it appears that they will stay.

 For those who want to practice trad, (perhaps with the security of back up bolts?) start under the overhanging right corner of this block. Pull through the crux start without any pro for 15 feet (or clip the bolt). Once through the start, climb easier holds to the overhanging section and better pro. Pull through the overhanging section and find some long reachy slopers at the top.
content.protection: There are now bolts on this route.  A standard trad rack will protect for those wanting to practice trad.
content.location:
Located on the righthand arete on the Bulge Block.

 Route #9 on Bulge Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Origianly a trad line.  Never saw any activity until bolted in early 2000.  Now a popular route at the Lost Crag.  Near corridor that blows cool air in summer and FRIGID air the rest of the time.  Great on hot days.
content.location:
Center of the left face.

 Route #6 on Bulge Block on 2019 guide.

content.description:
Start just 10' left of Lichenville.  This climb was named for Dick Watson, Bob Dodson and Tom Brooks ... all legendary Pittsburgh climbers who have stepped up and been of great help in the recent surge of stewardship in the region.  The three of them together have over 100 years experience climbing in SWPA.  Appropriately enough, all three of them spent a good bit of time helping to clean and drill holes for this particular route.  They all continue to inspire us.

 "I don't wanna be the last man standing, on second thought, maybe I do" --Willie Nelson
content.protection:
Three bolts with options for gear between the first and second bolts, and the second and third bolts.  

 Strong climbers may choose to lead on bolts only. If you choose to do so, please be mindful of potential falls.
content.location:
This route is located on the lefthand side of the Bulge Block. It is 10' left of the route Lichenville.

 Route #5 on Bulge Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: This arete starts with some big moves coming off the ground. Start under the overhang pulling through to gain the arete. The remainder of the route is more chill to the anchors.
content.location: Climber's right arete of the east facing face. Route #10 on Bulge Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Tricky getting to first bolt, crux at top.  May need brushed.  Very good route that sees little activity.
content.location:
Left of 3 sport climbs on the right face of this block. Climb starts directly between the boulder and the block.

 Route #11 on Bulge Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: Start just left of a rotting stump. Climb up the short technical face to a ledge and the first bolt. Make a move off the ledge passing the second bolt. Move right to the thin face holds and the third bolt, continue up to the shuts.  Like its two neighbors to the left, this route will most likely need brushed some more.
content.location: Righthand side of the Bulge Block. Right climb of the three sport lines. Route #13 on Bulge Block on 2019 guide.

content.description: The face on the left side of the block is not to be missed.  You will find three of The Lost Crag's best moderates here.  The three routes on the face on the right side of the block (#s 11-13) are notoriously dank at the top.  Same goes for #8, "Puckered Green."  While many SWPACC volunteers have already spent a good deal of time bringing these climbs back into play, we would love for some others to put in even more time wire brushing the tops of these climbs so that we can get them in even better shape.
